intro: Asperula setosa, commonly known as the slender woodruff, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant produces small, fragrant white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive texture. Asperula setosa is typically found in woodland edges and rocky soils, where it thrives in partial shade.
